item.title: Ten things to know beyond base R
item.description: 1. The pipe The pipe refers to the %>% operator from the {magrittr} package. library(magrittr) It may seem complicated at first, but what the pipe does is actually quite simple. That is, it allows users to write linear code. To illustrate use of the pipe, consider the following code that takes the mean of the log of three numbers: mean(log(c(1, 3, 9))) #> [1] 1.098612 Notice how the numbers c(1, 3, 9) are nested inside the log() function, which is then nested inside the mean() function?
